I want to be very clear about what this place is.  This is essentially a Spanish diner.  It serves diner food (of a Spanish variety) in a diner atmosphere.  It seemed like the clientele was mostly locals, tourists looking for the real thing (I was in that category), and young adults having a pre-bar or -club meal.Some of our dishes, the salads in particular, were nothing to write home about.  My girlfriend got the salmon entree,  which was on the special menu, and it was fantastic - super-fresh and perfectly cooked!  That dish gets 5 stars.  My Catalan white beans and sausage tasted good but possibly reheated.I think the moral of the story is, stick to the daily specials.  This is a fine, very down to earth (kind of divey) place for a cheap dinner and different atmosphere from most of what else I saw in Barcelona.
